t: Proverbs 26
As*p snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.
As*p the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
A*p whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.
Answer*p not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
Answer*p a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
He*p that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
The*p legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
As*p he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
As*p a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
The*p great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
As*p a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
Seest*p thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
The*p slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.
As*p the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.
The*p slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
The*p sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
He*p that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
As*p a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
So*p is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
Where*p no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
As*p coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
The*p words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
Burning*p lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
He*p that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
When*p he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
Whose*p hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
Whoso*p diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
A*p lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
